Articles.Content:
Can the cooldown period for the Search Function please be modified? Just now I tried searching for something, and instead of using the function 3 or 4 times to get the result, I had to attempt it at least 10 or 12 times due to the cooldown. Specifically, I searched for oneweb, then clicked the "in content titles only" link (this counts as another search), only to realize I should search for one web (space included), again titles only link. I still got too many results so I tried "one web", and this is where I started hitting the cooldown. You get my point. The number of legitimate searches can quickly add up, even for a genuine search of one concept.

I know why the mechanism is there, it's just that the cooldown starts way too soon. Give us 15 or so unimpeded searches before cooldowns start. That should give us enough attempts, presumably without bogging down the system.

Pretty please?
Did you get an error message? What did it say?

Quote

Sorry, there is a problem

Please wait 2 seconds before attempting another search

Error code: 1C205/3
Our IT department has kindly shortened the cooldown, but it's still needed to prevent overloading the system.

Please forward the virtual cookie jar to the IT department.

Have some yourself on the way.
